instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot hang intermittent
threads.message:
No visible damage.

Sometimes hangs. In verbose mode it hangs on "vm swap subsystem is on" just before you would normally see desktop appear.
It does not always do this but mostly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot hang intermittent
threads.message: Never mind. It's GPU I'll slap another one on there.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot hang intermittent
threads.message: Do you even read the sticky about this?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot hang intermittent
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 17104"]Do you even read the sticky about this?[/QUOTE]

Yes when it was first posted. I was rather excited by the prospect of a little solder touch-up but touching up <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> made no improvement in this case.
I heated the GPU and it booted 20 times in a row 2 days apart with no hang. On this occasion I'll just replace the GPU for a new one.
Great bit of sharing on the sticky but it did not work this time.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot hang intermittent
threads.message: these 3332's seem like a piece of shit
